issue.title: regionprops inscribed circles properties

labels.name: :sleeping: Dormant
labels.description: no recent activity

issue.body:
### Description:

It would be great if regionprops have the ability to estimate the: 1) maximum inscribed circle, and 2) minimum circumscribed circle. The output for each would be a diameter/radius and a center.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10503349/234850667-97a22d79-800c-45a7-a6f6-caf5205c1a04.png)


# Alternatives
The properties can be estimated by extracting the mask for each identified label (e.g., using the boundaries of the label obtained using region props) and passing it to the functions below. The code is modified from https://gist.github.com/DIYer22/f82dc329b27c2766b21bec4a563703cc

```python
def maximum_inscribed_circle(mask: np.ndarray) -> tuple[float, np.ndarray]:
    """Gets the maximum inscribed circle"""
    dist_map = cv2.distanceTransform(mask.astype(np.uint8), cv2.DIST_L2, cv2.DIST_MASK_PRECISE)
    _, radius, _, center = cv2.minMaxLoc(dist_map)
    diameter = 2 * radius
    return diameter, center

def minimum_circumscribed_circle(mask: np.ndarray) -> tuple[float, np.ndarray]:
    """returns the diameter of the minimum circumscribed circle"""
    contours, _ = cv2.findContours(mask.astype(np.uint8), cv2.RETR_TREE, cv2.CHAIN_APPROX_SIMPLE)[-2:]
    center, radius = cv2.minEnclosingCircle(np.concatenate(contours, 0))
    diameter = 2 * radius
    return diameter, center

```

comment.body: Hi @MosGeo ! Could you elaborate on the potential usecases of these properties in image processing tasks? I have not personally seen inscribed/circumscribed circles used that much, as `. bbox` is often just enough.

issue.title: Link to skimage contributing page on NUMFOCUS website is broken
issue.body:
### Description:

"https://numfocus.org/support#volunteer -> scikit-image" points at https://scikit-image.org/docs/dev/contribute.html, which returns 404.

### Way to reproduce:

_No response_

### Version information:

_No response_

issue.title: Use consistent notation for array dimensions in the docstrings

labels.description: Updates, fixes and additions to documentation

issue.body:
## References
Closes https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image/issues/2276.

## For reviewers

(Don't remove the checklist below.)

- [ ] Check that the PR title is short, concise, and will make sense 1 year
  later.
- [ ] Check that new functions are imported in corresponding `__init__.py`.
- [ ] Check that new features, API changes, and deprecations are mentioned in
      `doc/release/release_dev.rst`.

comment.body: Thank you @jni! Interestingly, my PyCharm was suggesting the formatting opposite to PEP. All the cases are now fixed.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -876,7 +873,7 @@ def find_local_maxima_idx(hist):
     elif counter == max_num_iter - 1:
         raise RuntimeError('Maximum iteration reached for histogram' 'smoothing')
 
-    # Find lowest point between the maxima
+    # Find the lowest point between the maxima
comment.body: I agree with @soupault: this is taking two maxima in the histogram and finding the minimum point between them. It is not (in general) one of the maxima.

     Parameters
     ----------
-    image : (M, N[, D]) array
+    image : ([P, ]M, N) array
         2-D or 3-D input image.
-    template : (m, n[, d]) array
-        Template to locate. It must be `(m <= M, n <= N[, d <= D])`.
+    template : ([p, ]m, n) array
+        Template to locate. It must be `(m <= M, n <= N[, p <= P])`.
comment.body: Maybe my comment relates to an earlier version? 🤷 anyway, all good! 👍

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,7 +41,7 @@ def polygon_area(pr, pc):
 
     Parameters
     ----------
-    pr, pc : (N,) array of float
+    pr, pc : (K, ) array of float
comment.body:
```suggestion
    pr, pc : (K,) array of float
```

This isn't code, but PEP8 explicitly forbids a space between a trailing comma and the closing parenthesis, and I don't see a good reason to deviate from PEP8 here?

pull_request.body:
## References
Closes https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image/issues/2276.

## For reviewers

(Don't remove the checklist below.)

- [ ] Check that the PR title is short, concise, and will make sense 1 year
  later.
- [ ] Check that new functions are imported in corresponding `__init__.py`.
- [ ] Check that new features, API changes, and deprecations are mentioned in
      `doc/release/release_dev.rst`.

review.body:
@soupault awesome, thanks for this work! 🙏 

Only gripe is the `(K, )` formatting with the trailing whitespace, which is actually forbidden by PEP8, [in the "pet peeves" section no less](https://pep8.org/#pet-peeves):

> Avoid extraneous whitespace in the following situations:
> ...
> - Between a trailing comma and a following close parenthesis:

I've left suggestions but in your place I would just use find/sed e.g. as shown [in this SO answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/49346386/224254).

pull_request.title: Use consistent notation for array dimensions in the docstrings
